pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the map `CompHausLike.sigmaComparison` associated to a presheaf `X`¬†on
`CompHausLike P`, and a finite family `S‚ÇÅ,...,S‚Çô` of spaces in `CompHausLike P`, where `P` is
stable under taking finite disjoint unions.

The map `sigmaComparison`¬†is the canonical map `X(S‚ÇÅ ‚äî ... ‚äî S‚Çô) ‚ü∂ X(S‚ÇÅ) √ó ... √ó X(S‚Çô)` induced by
the inclusion maps `S·µ¢ ‚ü∂ S‚ÇÅ ‚äî ... ‚äî S‚Çô`, and it is an isomorphism when `X` preserves finite
products.

---

- [x]¬†depends on: #16178 

This is useful when proving that discrete condensed sets are given by locally constant maps, see #15321

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> Have I understood correctly that these theorems should fit into some quite general API about `HasExplicit(Co)Products` and `PreservesExplicit(Co)Products` (although that is of course out of the scope of this PR)? LGTM!

Well, this `HasExplicitFiniteCoproducts` applies only to `CompHausLike`, i.e. categories of topological spaces which are full subcategories of `CompHaus`. It just means that the category is closed under taking disjoint unions of topological spaces. This could of course be generalized to other concrete categories.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10680042398/job/29600618010)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10680042398/job/29600618607)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Have I understood correctly that these theorems should fit into some quite general API about `HasExplicit(Co)Products` and `PreservesExplicit(Co)Products` (although that is of course out of the scope of this PR)?  LGTM!

Have I understood correctly that these theorems should fit into some quite general API about `HasExplicit(Co)Products` and `PreservesExplicit(Co)Products` (although that is of course out of the scope of this PR)?  LGTM!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I am somewhat confused by why all of this is needed. It seems that the instance (for `Œ±'`) that's being used here is `preservesFiniteProductsOfPreservesBinaryAndTerminal`. However I don't see why `J` has to have type `Type` in that lemma. It seems to work just fine if I replace it with `Type*`, and in that case your instance can be provided by
```
  letI : Fintype Œ± := Fintype.ofFinite _
  preservesFiniteProductsOfPreservesBinaryAndTerminal X Œ±
```
which avoids creating this  `Œ±'`
I am unsure if the rest of mathlib compiles with that change, but I don't immediately see why not.
Another option would be if it is possible to adapt previous definition so that `Œ±` is allowed to have type `Type`
I just made #16178 to see that nothing breaks (and to see if anyone has opinions on this)
Thanks, this is much cleaner now.

```suggestion
  rw [‚Üê opCoproductIsoProduct_inv_comp_Œπ]
```
This also seems to compile for me

```suggestion
```
This line does not seem to be necessary for the proof to compile (for me), but maybe there are peformance / readability reasons to include it? Up to you.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/CompHaus): sigma-comparison map
